6.23.18  Rewriting tan(x) in terms of cos(2x) and sin(2x): tan2cossin2

The tan2cossin2 command replaces tan(x) by 1−cos(2x)/sin(2x) in an expression.

  • tan2cossin2 takes one argument:
    expr, an expression containing trigonometric functions.
  • tan2cossin2(expr) returns expr with anything of the form tan(x) replaced by 1−cos(2x)/sin(2x).


Example.
Input:

tan2cossin2(tan(x))

Output:

1−cos⎛
⎝		2 x⎞
⎠
sin⎛
⎝		2 x⎞
⎠
